alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 01 at 3:52AM PST until January 01 at 11:00AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .The Skokomish River will continue to recede today, falling below flood stage within the next few hours. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Skokomish River at Potlatch. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause widespread flooding of pasture lands, with water flowing quickly over West Bourgault Road and Skokomish Valley Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 AM PST Sunday the stage was 16.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:15 AM PST Sunday was 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this morning. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.5 feet on 12/14/1995. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this morning at 1100 AM PST.
